016package de.cuioss.uimodel.application;
017
018import static de.cuioss.tools.string.MoreStrings.isEmpty;
019
020import java.io.Serializable;
021
022import lombok.AllArgsConstructor;
023import lombok.Builder;
024import lombok.EqualsAndHashCode;
025import lombok.Getter;
026import lombok.NoArgsConstructor;
027import lombok.Setter;
028import lombok.ToString;
029
030/**
031 * Simple class providing credentials for form-based login
032 *
033 * @author Oliver Wolff
034 */
035@EqualsAndHashCode(exclude = "password", doNotUseGetters = true)
036@ToString(exclude = "password", doNotUseGetters = true)
037@Builder
038@NoArgsConstructor
039@AllArgsConstructor
040public class LoginCredentials implements Serializable {
041
042    private static final long serialVersionUID = -5554252114058479008L;
043
044    @Getter
045    @Setter
046    private String password;
047
048    @Getter
049    @Setter
050    private String username;
051
052    @Getter
053    @Setter
054    private String userStore;
055
056    @Getter
057    @Setter
058    private boolean rememberLoginCredentials;
059
060    /**
061     * Checks whether the given credentials are syntactically correct, saying
062     * {@link #getUsername()} and {@link #getPassword()} are neither null nor empty.
063     *
064     * @return boolean indicating the completeness of the configuration
065     */
066    public boolean isComplete() {
067        return !isEmpty(getUsername()) && !isEmpty(getPassword());
068    }
069
070}
